formalMetadata.description: Document containing two mandatory text input fields (first name, last name) that are already filled and set to read-only. In addition, it contains one text input field for entering the date of birth with mandatory input. If the user submits and no date is entered or the date is invalid, the error is identified and described to the user in text below the form (JavaScript).
formalMetadata.title: Mandatory text input field with error correction (date)

purpose.p: The document is intended to fail, because the input error is specified and presented to the user in text but screenreader users may not notice the error message that is presented below the form.

expertGuidance.p: For the design of accessible forms it is particularly important to verify appropriateness with assistive technologies like screen readers and ensure proper navigation for users who can access the form by keyboard only. Therefore the expert user is advised to evaluate the form also in this respect. Beyond this it should be mentioned that in order to ensure accessibility of a form presented on a website, it might be necessary to validate the design by the target user group.

userGuidance.p: You will be presented a form where several items are already filled in, but the last one is empty. For the empty item you are asked to provide a date of birth. To provoke an error, please fill in 45/45/206 as date and submit the form. Once the error screen has appeared, please correct the date.

U zult een formulier te zien krijgen waarin verschillende invoergegevens reeds ingevuld zijn, maar het laatste is leeg. Voor het lege veld zal u gevraagd worden een geboortedatum in te vullen. Om een fout te veroorzaken, vul 45/45/206 in als geboortedatum en verstuur het formulier (via de submit knop). Nadat het scherm met de foutmelding is verschenen, verbeter de datum.

questionText.p: Was it easy to correct the date?
Was het makkelijk de datum te verbeteren ?

optionOther.p: If not, please describe here the problems you encountered. All comments are welcome!
Indien niet, beschrijf hier de problemen die u hebt ondervonden. Alle opmerkingen zijn welkom!

functionalOutcome.p: Before submission, the error is specified and presented to the user. However, user testing with JAWS and HomePage Reader highlighted the following problem: after submission of the form without a real date, the focus remains on the submit button, so screenreader users may not notice the error message below the form.

techComment.p: This test case does not map to a WCAG 2.0 technique or failure. (The test case may map to "Providing client-side validation and adding error text via the DOM (future link)" in a future draft.)
